weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, the atmosphere is heavy with the promise of rain, cloaked in a heavy blanket of clouds that turn the day dim. It is a time when nature seems to hold its breath, with showers and thunderstorms poised to awaken the streets. The high hovering near 58 gives way to a slow descent in heat, as the southwest winds whip through at 24 mph, making the cool air feel even brisker. There is an unmistakable charge in the atmosphere, as the forecast whispers of up to half an inch of rain, urging residents to seek shelter under awnings or umbrellas, which may serve as trusted companions throughout the day.

As night approaches, that same curtain of cloud will deepen, shrouding the city in a mystery only rain can weave. Those unusual who venture out might find comfort in cozy layers—perhaps a warm sweater beneath a waterproof jacket will do, paired with sturdy shoes to navigate the slick sidewalks. The heart of the city may become a sanctuary for coffee lovers, inviting folks into nearby cafés, where the clink of cups and whispered conversations dance in the air, offering refuge from the storm outside. Should you wish to brave the elements, a quick walk through the drizzle can be refreshing, but the best solace might lie in the warmth of familiarity, tucked away until the sun's cheerful rays return to restore clarity to this fog-laden drama.
